Class RunBank

  • java.lang.Object
    • RunBank

  • public class RunBank
extends java.lang.Object
    Taken from Derek Aguirre The RunBank class is what will be used to run most of the code for this assignment. A user can log in as a Customer or as a Bank manager. Both choices have different functions.
    Since:
    10/10/2020
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Derek Aguirre

      • fileRead

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Customer> fileRead(java.lang.String file)
                                              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                     java.io.IOException
        Taken from Derek Aguirre

        This method stores the contents of the input file "CS 3331 - Bank Users 4.csv" to an ArrayList of type Customer.

        It will utilize the ArrayList method add to push the information to the data structure.

        The data is pushed according to the fields of the Customer constructor.

        Parameters:
        file - the name of the file to read
        Returns:
        bank
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Input Output Exception
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - File not found
        See Also:
        Customer

      • generateUpdatedBalanceSheet

        public static void generateUpdatedBalanceSheet(java.util.ArrayList<Customer> customers)
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Taken from Derek Aguirre Will generate a file "Updated Balance Sheet.csv" that will reflect the updated account balances of every customer. This method is executed if a customer chooses the log out selection on the main directory. The balance sheet will show all information about every user.
        Parameters:
        customers - An array list of type customer
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - InputOutputException
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If file is not found it can also be thrown if the file is open when trying to be written to.
